text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- In discussions over the 1997 draft budget, deputies in parliament call for an end to price rises and raises in salaries of public sector employees.
- Jordanian firms win contracts in the Iraqi market.
- Drop in volume of stock and prices in the stock market.
- Transfer of the dispute between the electricity workers and the Jordan Electric Power company to the labour courts.
- Forty ministers register to discuss the 1997 budget and opposition and centrist deputies call on the government to end normalisation with Israel until it honours its commitments.
- New appointments in the Ministry of Communications and Postal Affairs.
- King Hussein and Queen Noor depart on a private visit to a number of European countries.
- Announcement soon of new customs tariffs on a list of imported goods and an expected drop in income tax collections by 25 million dinars ($35.3 million) next year, says deputy head of income tax.
- Crown Prince Hassan receives a telephone call from Palestinian leader on talks with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in the presence of the U.S. peace envoy Ross.
- House of Parliament begins review of draft budget.
